column5: hello walleye central peeps! we are planning a late may early june trip to nw ontario for 2017...we have been going to lake dayohessarah for 3 years for lakers and the fishing has been great,we are just looking to change up a bit... we are really interested in trophy pike and pickerel,,,dont care if the walleye are trophy,mostly just for dinner fare...specks would be a nice bonus too! hoping we can find a place for around a grand pp... would anyone have any info on a good outfitter or outpost camp that offers good trophy spring pike fishing?

a grand per week may be a bit limiting - but here's a housekeeping private lake option that we have had great success with - both trophy pike and walleye and a "taj mahal" cabin:https://www.walleyecentral.com/forums...ghlight=kearns phish
I like Attawapiskat (eddie north) for big gators. Decent pricing, especially if still doing canadian funds (not sure).
joyce lake seems to be the best value..i wish i could afford $1500 cad,but i just cant when i have to consider,food,gas,misc,tackle,booze **** i need to win a lottery
quants outpost seems reasonable as well

You might want to check out Slate Falls Outpost. You can do a five day trip to their Miniss Lake outposts for $990 after July 1. $125 for each additional day. We are booked to go to their Miniss East outpost for six days in mid Aug. of next year. This will be our 1st trip with Slate Falls. It looks like their cabins and equipment are top notch. They are highly recommended by posters on this forum. www.slatefallsoutposts.com
Are you dead set on ontario?
